Company: Office of Paul C. Brown, M.D., P.S.
Description of incident: An October 14, 2011 office burglary resulted in the exposure of patient information dating from 1993 to 2004.  Office equipment and CDs with patient information were discovered missing on October 17.  Affected patients were mailed notification letters on December 13, 2011 and informed that their names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, addresses, diagnoses, medical conditions, lab results, medications, surgery records, radiological tests, and other clinical treatment information could have been on the stolen CDs.  The office now plans to install encryption technology and update physical security systems in order to protect patient data from more breaches.
